ygData.subject: Re: Twinking = Diablo = UO
ygData.msgSnippet: If you are playing +PVP then I can see twinking have a negative effect on gameplay, but in -PVP it doesnt. Then all the honest players will be left behind
ygData.messageBody:
If you are playing +PVP then I can see twinking have a negative effect
on gameplay, but in -PVP it doesnt. "Then all the honest players will be
left behind" from your post suggests that you think the game is a race
to get to the finish line. Well, words in, the race was won by some
halfling rogue who reached lvl 50 before you.

If you don't like others twinking, don't adventure with them. Sneer at
them because they're "rich snobs who got money from mommy and daddy".
Challenge them to a duel, show them that it's not the size of the sword
that matters, and then take the bigger sword from them when you win!
Laugh at them when they die. Roleplay the jealous commoner who has to
work for his/her way in this world. And feel better knowing that you are
the true winner of the race to have fun and enjoy the game!

You know what I'm tired of? People trying to enforce their playing
styles on others. They think that just because a person does something
that they don't like (but doesn't actually hurt them) that the person
should be banned! Bah! Just as in real life there are people born with a
silver spoon up their a**. There are people who like to powergame and
dont roleplay. Live with it. Learn from it. And go buy yourself a
platinum spoon with your hard earned money. Then wave it in their face,
type /rude <twinker>, and go on your merry way.

Croesus Illuminatus (Xegony)
*Mobile Nuclear Weapons Silo*

Elkantar The Wizard wrote:
>
> From: "Elkantar The Wizard" <the_elkantar@...>
>
> I hear a lot of players say that it is wrong and I agree. I hear few say
> leave it alone! I and a lot of other players left twinking alone in UO and
> look where that game is now. Same for Diablo. It does effect me and my
> character cause it will lead to every other player having to twinkle just to
> play on even ground. Then all the honest players will be left behind like
> UO.
>
> Twinking the Definition....Giving high level gear to a low level character.
>
> I agree that "low level" is not lower level. I a 10th level wizard gave
> items to a fighter who is 7th level. Things I can not use but he can and it
> helps our party. He being only 3 levels under me. This just makes sense. But
> when a 20th level character gives items high in value to a less then 10th
> level character that is simply foolish and exploitable.
>
> Now at 5th level I did find a mighty magical item that someone had
> mistakenly dropped. I belive this is fair in the game. But to have a
> character outfitted by other, in a guild or no, is simply cheating and will
> ruin the balance of the game.
>
> Elkantar Keeper of the Tome of Magi Lore
>
